texts.label: text
texts.orig: If you have a centralized syslog server, or you use Splunk for log tracking, you may find the need to get older log files into a syslog port on that server.
texts.text: If you have a centralized syslog server, or you use Splunk for log tracking, you may find the need to get older log files into a syslog port on that server.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Edit:  Using logger (as suggested by David and Jerry below) will give you a more reliable way to send the data to a syslog server:
texts.text: Edit:  Using logger (as suggested by David and Jerry below) will give you a more reliable way to send the data to a syslog server:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: You'll also be able to set a label for the text before it's piped into the syslog server, which would be handy if you're sorting or parsing the data later on.
texts.text: You'll also be able to set a label for the text before it's piped into the syslog server, which would be handy if you're sorting or parsing the data later on.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Also, you can send your data in the raw using netcat:
